title: Software Technical Sales Engineer (Ingénieur Technico-Commercial)-Bilingual
description:
Due to our high growth in Quebec and Ontario, we are seeking exceptional individuals who can juggle amazing communication skills (in both official languages), with technical proficiency and a desire to help us close deals and build an even bigger presence in the region.
Location:
Cornwall, Ontario.
Role:
The Technical Sales Engineer (TSE) is a person who masters our business software products and effectively communicates their value to prospective customers over the phone / online presentations.
In this role the TSE will have a broad technical understanding of our prospective customers needs and requirements and be able to demonstrate how the software will achieve those ends.
Responsibilities:

Master multiple software products


Lead customer calls, understand their requirements, and provide solutions to their business needs.


Demonstrate a product's capabilities to prospective customers.


Respond to support questions via email, chat and phone.


Work closely with the sales team and collaborate with multiple teams across the organization.

Skills:

Good understanding of business software and ability to learn new products quickly - we currently have more than 45 products.


Ability to articulate the value of business software to prospective customers over the phone and through demonstrations.


Adept at listening to and interpreting a customer’s business needs and suggesting the appropriate product solutions.


Able to respond quickly and efficiently to a variety of technical questions


Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both official languages.


Technologically savvy and passionate about technology and solving real-world business challenges.


Preferred: Experience in a phone, email, and/or web-chat based technical support or customer consulting role.


Preferred: Understanding of standard business applications software (CRM, Accounting, Help Desk, Analytics, Project Management etc)


Fluent in English and French.

Compensation and Terms:

This is initially a contract-based position. Successful applicants will be offered a six-month contract, after which they may qualify for full-time positions.
Hourly compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience.


Contractors are not offered benefits. Those who transition to full-time positions will be offered a full suite of generous benefits, including medical, dental, and vision insurance, RRSP matching contributions.

The most successful Zoho team-members are:

At home in a diverse, multicultural workplace


Quick on their feet


Comfortable with ambiguity and complexity


Flexible and patient, with an "all hands on deck" attitude


Comfortable with giving and receiving constructive feedback for the benefit of the team


Not constrained by their job title and ready to contribute to the company on many levels.


Genuine and sincere

About Zoho:
Zoho Corp. is one of the fastest growing leaders in the software industry globally.
Zoho is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and all applicants will be given full consideration without attention to race, religion, ethnicity, national original, veteran or disability status, sex, gender, gender presentation, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by local, state, or federal laws.
Successful applicants undergo a standard background check and demonstrate eligibility to work in Canada.

title: Backend Product Software Engineer, New Initiatives - Remote
description:
Role Description We're looking for a versatile engineer to join our team and work on one of our exciting explorations. As a valuable member of our organization, you'll play a crucial role in inventing new technologies and transforming rapid prototypes into robust, high-quality software solutions that seamlessly integrate with our partners. Your expertise and dedication will be instrumental in driving the success of Dropbox's new initiatives and identifying the product-market fit for our new product. You'll have the exhilarating experience of learning, iterating, and adapting based on valuable feedback and data insights. 

 If you thrive in fast-paced, startup-like environments and excel at problem-solving, this is the perfect opportunity for you. With your deep curiosity and passion for continuous learning, you'll stay on top of new technologies and industry trends. Taking ownership of projects, wearing multiple hats, and thriving in ambiguous situations come naturally to you. If you're an engineer who loves challenges, seeks ownership, and is motivated to turn ideas into reality, we want to hear from you! 

 Responsibilities Take ownership of the entire project lifecycle, from designing and prototyping to implementing, deploying, and measuring metrics for success. Drive innovation by creating customer-centric prototypes for new product explorations. Foster collaboration and inspire virtual teams to work seamlessly across the organization, leading to positive outcomes and meaningful change. Serve as a role model for your team, demonstrating exceptional technical expertise and leadership skills. 

 Proactively communicate your learnings and progress to your team and leadership, ensuring transparency and alignment throughout the organization. Requirements 10+ years of engineering experience and proficiency in multiple programming languages, including Python and TypeScript. Extensive knowledge in building interpreters and runtimes. Experienced in developing full-stack web applications using React, Python, or similar technologies. 

 Proven track record of successfully tackling complex technical challenges with innovative solutions. Strong ability to quickly grasp and apply complex concepts and technologies, including LLMs. Exposure to building developer tools. Many teams at Dropbox run Services with on-call rotations, which entails being available for calls during both core and non-core business hours. 

 If a team has an on-call rotation, all engineers on the team are expected to participate in the rotation as part of their employment. Applicants are encouraged to ask for more details of the rotations to which the applicant is applying. Total Rewards Our Engineering Career Framework is viewable by anyone outside the company and describes what’s expected for our engineers at each of our career levels. Check out our blog post on this topic and more here. 

 Salary/OTE is just one component of Dropbox’s total rewards package. All regular employees are also eligible for the corporate bonus program or a sales incentive (target included in OTE) as well as stock in the form of Restricted Stock Units (RSUs). Current Salary/OTE Ranges (Subject to change): C$178,500 - C$210,000 - C$241,500

title: Software Development Team Leader
description:
We are seeking a dynamic Software Development Team Leader to lead our team of software developers in designing, developing, delivering, and maintaining Sagacity’s software solutions. This position requires a combination of requirements analysis, agile project coordination, technical expertise, and skills mentoring.
Reporting to a Development Manager, the day-to-day tasks involve defining requirements and specifications, leading daily agile scrums, resolving technical roadblocks, collaborating with other departments such as QA and support, and driving the day-to-day development schedule to ensure that our software products are delivered on time and meet customer requirements.
If you are a motivated and results-driven individual with a passion for software development, we encourage you to apply and grow within a dynamic and innovative technology company.
Key Responsibilities:

Provide team leadership, mentoring, and day to day guidance to the software development team to implement the objectives of the Development Manager.
Communicate clear expectations and regular feedback to team members set by the Development Manager.
Set daily goals for the team members and ensure that they are aligned with the company's overall strategy.
Lead by example through hands-on technical contributions to the development team’s efforts.
Assist in architectural decisions, code reviews, and ensuring adherence to coding standards.
Translate business requirements into technical requirements, by communicating with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Regularly communicate project status, updates, and challenges to your Development Manager and stakeholders.
Manage the day-to-day software development lifecycle, from project initiation to deployment and delivery
In collaboration with Development Manager and stakeholders, define and document project requirements, goals, and deliverables.
Drive defined project schedules, ensuring timely delivery of milestones and products.
Identify project risks, proactively addressing potential roadblocks.
Evaluate and refine development processes to enhance efficiency, quality, and team productivity.
Select best practices, tools, and methodologies to better streamline development and ensure consistent code quality.
Identify opportunities for automation and optimization to increase development speed and reliability.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including IoT and Communications R&D, Quality Assurance (QA), Support, Data, and Security Teams and other stakeholders on product delivery and meeting customer requirements.
Foster a collaborative and innovative team culture that encourages knowledge sharing and professional growth.

Qualifications:

Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
At least 2 years experience leading software development, with demonstrated success
A strong grasp of various programming languages, frameworks, and technologies.
Strong understanding of software development methodologies (Agile, Scrum, etc.) and best practices.
Ability to define and maintain project plans and schedules.
Experience working with cross-functional teams, such as R&D, testing, support, and technical sales.
Experience with collaborative version control systems and project management tools such as Bitbucket, Git, and Jira.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to make well-informed decisions under pressure.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience as a Scrum Master
Agile mythologies certifications or credentials
Mentoring or Leadership certifications or credentials
Familiarity with cloud-based development platforms, such as AWS.

Job Summary











































































 Job Description





































 Ownr is on an ambitious mission to help Canadian entrepreneurs start and grow their businesses. We are building a platform that takes the difficulty out of registering and maintaining sole proprietorships and corporations, letting our incredible business owners save time and money to focus on what matters - building their business. We’ve already helped start over 150,000 companies, and we’re just getting started. Being a part of RBCx Ventures, we are a unique type of business. We chart our course developing the technology our clients need, delivering frequently and continually improving our applications and processes. At the same time, we have direct access to the technical resources, expertise and opportunities of one of the world’s leading financial institutions.

 We are looking for a talented individual and passionate team player to join the Ownr team as a Software Engineer 2. You’ll be playing a big part in building the next evolution of our platform as we move to provide extensive new capabilities to business owners, working alongside a close-knit group of fun and ambitious engineers, product managers and designers. Your experience will contribute to the functionality, reliability, and delivery of our fast-moving Node/React-based application, leveraging the latest JavaScript-based tooling and best practices.

 The Opportunity

 You’ll have visibility into, and influence over, all parts of the technology stack, and enjoy a high degree of autonomy in your work.
 You’ll have a clear view of the product roadmap, the business’ long-term vision, and the opportunity to constructively contribute to both.
 You’ll contribute to the planning, design, development, deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of significant portions of the software that supports our users.
 You’ll have the chance to provide and receive feedback from your peers, and get coaching from more experienced engineers both within the team and the broader organization.
 You’ll use modern tooling throughout, whether that’s something currently part of our stack, or something new that you assess needs to be added to reliably deliver the desired user experience. A snapshot of what’s currently in-use:

 Web client: React, Styled Components
 Web server: Node.js, JavaScript, TypeScript, Express
 DB: PostgreSQL
 Infrastructure: Heroku and AWS (services include: RabbitMQ, Redis, s3, etc.)
 CI/CD: CircleCI and Github Actions
 Testing frameworks: Jest, React Testing Library, Cypress



 About you

 You have have 2+ years experience using JavaScript to build real world applications, preferably public facing. You have a good understanding of development patterns and best practices and how they can impact your ability to be productive in a codebase and by extension, the maintainability of a platform.
 You have experience building, monitoring and maintaining software that is highly available, scalable, and resilient.
 You’ll take responsibility for finding opportunities to iteratively improve our technology in any feature you work on, paying down technical debt as a habit
 You’ll put in the work necessary to empathize with the software’s users and understand their challenges, whether those users are fellow developers, immediate team members, or the entrepreneurs that rely on us to support their business.
 You’re curious, and naturally invest energy into learning new technologies, techniques, and interpersonal skills that you feel help improve your own productivity and happiness, and the productivity and happiness of those around you.
 You have excellent spoken and written communication, time management, and project management abilities. You behave proactively to set expectations and find support when you recognize that there are unforeseen challenges or complexity in projects. 
You are comfortable asking questions and speaking up to help us continuously improve how we do things.


 What’s in it for you?
 We thrive on the challenge to be our best and work together to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. Here is what you can expect if you join our team:

 Work in an agile, collaborative and high-performing team
 The opportunity to do work that is challenging and take on progressively larger responsibilities
 Leaders who support your development through regular coaching
 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including competitive compensation, bonuses and flexible benefits


 About Ownr
 At Ownr, we have helped thousands of Canadians establish their businesses. As we redefine the entrepreneurship landscape, we take pride in simplifying what it takes to be a business owner. We're on a mission to become the leading platform for entrepreneurship in Canada, and it takes an entire team to build something big. So join our team and discover how we can help entrepreneurs make their dreams a reality.

 About RBCx
 RBCx pursues big, bold ideas and leverages RBC’s extensive experience, networks, and capital to help shape what’s next. Our four pillars – Banking, Capital, Platform, and Ventures – combine to support tech businesses of all sizes and stages, making us the go-to backer of Canadian innovation. Our people are our most valuable assets, which is why we invest deeply in making sure RBCx isn’t just a place to work, but a place to belong.

description:
Why Verifone
 For more than 30 years Verifone has established a remarkable record of leadership in the electronic payment technology industry. Verifone has one of the leading electronic payment solutions brands and is one of the largest providers of electronic payment systems worldwide.
 Verifone has a diverse, dynamic and fast paced work environment in which employees are focused on results and have opportunities to excel. We take pride in the fact that we work with leading retailers, merchants, banks, and third party partners to invent and deliver innovative payments solution around the world. We strive for excellence in our products and services, and are obsessed with customer happiness. Across the globe, Verifone employees are leading the payments industry through experience, innovation, and an ambitious spirit. Whether it's developing the next platform of secure payment systems or searching for new ways to bring electronic payments to new markets, the team at Verifone is dedicated to the success of our customers, partners and investors. It is this passion for innovation that drives each one of our employees for personal and professionalsuccess.
 What's exciting about the role


Collaborate with engineers and acquirer representatives to understand product requirements to ensure successful remediation.
Triage and report failed test cases to development departments and facilitate investigation and delivery for any potential solutions.
Document the reported certification defects in JIRA, and work with development team to take appropriate corrective actions to improve/correct design.
Overview key design decisions, technology choice, structure and configuration of the solution ensuring it aligns with the certification requirements.
Report new or recurring problems to development departments and works to solutions.
Obtain, clarify, and impart technical knowledge regarding existing and newly released VeriFone products.
Identify and present solutions for process improvements.
Perform other related duties as assigned.


Skills and Experience we desire


Recognized Degree / Diploma in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a computer-related discipline.
Working knowledge of EMV transactions processing and EMV test tools.
Working experience in testing, product validation and payment application certifications in the card payments or banking industry,
Working experience with the banking/finance industry and/or payment applications.
Sense of urgency and drive to succeed. You should be comfortable working within a deadline driven environment, and flexible to work overtime when needed.
Proven track record working in a multitasking and dynamic environment.
Understanding of the complete end to end of software delivery and standard methodologies.
Experience working with hardware, software, QA, and product management teams.
Ability to learn and adapt to industry practices and company policies and procedures.
Self-motivated fast learner and great teammate who takes initiative and collaborates with others.

Personal Attributes:

High energy level, can-do mentality, resilient, and good work ethic.
We value integrity, honesty, maturity.
You have a strong partner and customer focus.
Committed to striving for continuous improvement every single day, while also having fun. You identify as a dedicated, creative self-starter who isn't afraid to take initiative.

Our commitment
 Verifone is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Verifone is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Backend Product Software Engineer, New Initiatives - Remote
description:
Role Description We're looking for a versatile engineer to join our team and work on one of our exciting explorations. As a valuable member of our organization, you'll play a crucial role in inventing new technologies and transforming rapid prototypes into robust, high-quality software solutions that seamlessly integrate with our partners. Your expertise and dedication will be instrumental in driving the success of Dropbox's new initiatives and identifying the product-market fit for our new product. You'll have the exhilarating experience of learning, iterating, and adapting based on valuable feedback and data insights. 

 If you thrive in fast-paced, startup-like environments and excel at problem-solving, this is the perfect opportunity for you. With your deep curiosity and passion for continuous learning, you'll stay on top of new technologies and industry trends. Taking ownership of projects, wearing multiple hats, and thriving in ambiguous situations come naturally to you. If you're an engineer who loves challenges, seeks ownership, and is motivated to turn ideas into reality, we want to hear from you! 

 Responsibilities Take ownership of the entire project lifecycle, from designing and prototyping to implementing, deploying, and measuring metrics for success. Drive innovation by creating customer-centric prototypes for new product explorations. Foster collaboration and inspire virtual teams to work seamlessly across the organization, leading to positive outcomes and meaningful change. Serve as a role model for your team, demonstrating exceptional technical expertise and leadership skills. 

 Proactively communicate your learnings and progress to your team and leadership, ensuring transparency and alignment throughout the organization. Requirements 10+ years of engineering experience and proficiency in multiple programming languages, including Python and TypeScript. Extensive knowledge in building interpreters and runtimes. Experienced in developing full-stack web applications using React, Python, or similar technologies. 

 Proven track record of successfully tackling complex technical challenges with innovative solutions. Strong ability to quickly grasp and apply complex concepts and technologies, including LLMs. Exposure to building developer tools. Many teams at Dropbox run Services with on-call rotations, which entails being available for calls during both core and non-core business hours. 

 If a team has an on-call rotation, all engineers on the team are expected to participate in the rotation as part of their employment. Applicants are encouraged to ask for more details of the rotations to which the applicant is applying. Total Rewards Our Engineering Career Framework is viewable by anyone outside the company and describes what’s expected for our engineers at each of our career levels. Check out our blog post on this topic and more here. 

 Salary/OTE is just one component of Dropbox’s total rewards package. All regular employees are also eligible for the corporate bonus program or a sales incentive (target included in OTE) as well as stock in the form of Restricted Stock Units (RSUs). Current Salary/OTE Ranges (Subject to change): C$178,500 - C$210,000 - C$241,500

description:
We are seeking a dynamic Software Development Team Leader to lead our team of software developers in designing, developing, delivering, and maintaining Sagacity’s software solutions. This position requires a combination of requirements analysis, agile project coordination, technical expertise, and skills mentoring.
Reporting to a Development Manager, the day-to-day tasks involve defining requirements and specifications, leading daily agile scrums, resolving technical roadblocks, collaborating with other departments such as QA and support, and driving the day-to-day development schedule to ensure that our software products are delivered on time and meet customer requirements.
If you are a motivated and results-driven individual with a passion for software development, we encourage you to apply and grow within a dynamic and innovative technology company.
Key Responsibilities:

Provide team leadership, mentoring, and day to day guidance to the software development team to implement the objectives of the Development Manager.
Communicate clear expectations and regular feedback to team members set by the Development Manager.
Set daily goals for the team members and ensure that they are aligned with the company's overall strategy.
Lead by example through hands-on technical contributions to the development team’s efforts.
Assist in architectural decisions, code reviews, and ensuring adherence to coding standards.
Translate business requirements into technical requirements, by communicating with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Regularly communicate project status, updates, and challenges to your Development Manager and stakeholders.
Manage the day-to-day software development lifecycle, from project initiation to deployment and delivery
In collaboration with Development Manager and stakeholders, define and document project requirements, goals, and deliverables.
Drive defined project schedules, ensuring timely delivery of milestones and products.
Identify project risks, proactively addressing potential roadblocks.
Evaluate and refine development processes to enhance efficiency, quality, and team productivity.
Select best practices, tools, and methodologies to better streamline development and ensure consistent code quality.
Identify opportunities for automation and optimization to increase development speed and reliability.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including IoT and Communications R&D, Quality Assurance (QA), Support, Data, and Security Teams and other stakeholders on product delivery and meeting customer requirements.
Foster a collaborative and innovative team culture that encourages knowledge sharing and professional growth.

Qualifications:

Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
At least 2 years experience leading software development, with demonstrated success
A strong grasp of various programming languages, frameworks, and technologies.
Strong understanding of software development methodologies (Agile, Scrum, etc.) and best practices.
Ability to define and maintain project plans and schedules.
Experience working with cross-functional teams, such as R&D, testing, support, and technical sales.
Experience with collaborative version control systems and project management tools such as Bitbucket, Git, and Jira.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to make well-informed decisions under pressure.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience as a Scrum Master
Agile mythologies certifications or credentials
Mentoring or Leadership certifications or credentials
Familiarity with cloud-based development platforms, such as AWS.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Job Summary











































































 Job Description





































 Ownr is on an ambitious mission to help Canadian entrepreneurs start and grow their businesses. We are building a platform that takes the difficulty out of registering and maintaining sole proprietorships and corporations, letting our incredible business owners save time and money to focus on what matters - building their business. We’ve already helped start over 150,000 companies, and we’re just getting started. Being a part of RBCx Ventures, we are a unique type of business. We chart our course developing the technology our clients need, delivering frequently and continually improving our applications and processes. At the same time, we have direct access to the technical resources, expertise and opportunities of one of the world’s leading financial institutions.

 We are looking for a talented individual and passionate team player to join the Ownr team as a Software Engineer 2. You’ll be playing a big part in building the next evolution of our platform as we move to provide extensive new capabilities to business owners, working alongside a close-knit group of fun and ambitious engineers, product managers and designers. Your experience will contribute to the functionality, reliability, and delivery of our fast-moving Node/React-based application, leveraging the latest JavaScript-based tooling and best practices.

 The Opportunity

 You’ll have visibility into, and influence over, all parts of the technology stack, and enjoy a high degree of autonomy in your work.
 You’ll have a clear view of the product roadmap, the business’ long-term vision, and the opportunity to constructively contribute to both.
 You’ll contribute to the planning, design, development, deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of significant portions of the software that supports our users.
 You’ll have the chance to provide and receive feedback from your peers, and get coaching from more experienced engineers both within the team and the broader organization.
 You’ll use modern tooling throughout, whether that’s something currently part of our stack, or something new that you assess needs to be added to reliably deliver the desired user experience. A snapshot of what’s currently in-use:

 Web client: React, Styled Components
 Web server: Node.js, JavaScript, TypeScript, Express
 DB: PostgreSQL
 Infrastructure: Heroku and AWS (services include: RabbitMQ, Redis, s3, etc.)
 CI/CD: CircleCI and Github Actions
 Testing frameworks: Jest, React Testing Library, Cypress



 About you

 You have have 2+ years experience using JavaScript to build real world applications, preferably public facing. You have a good understanding of development patterns and best practices and how they can impact your ability to be productive in a codebase and by extension, the maintainability of a platform.
 You have experience building, monitoring and maintaining software that is highly available, scalable, and resilient.
 You’ll take responsibility for finding opportunities to iteratively improve our technology in any feature you work on, paying down technical debt as a habit
 You’ll put in the work necessary to empathize with the software’s users and understand their challenges, whether those users are fellow developers, immediate team members, or the entrepreneurs that rely on us to support their business.
 You’re curious, and naturally invest energy into learning new technologies, techniques, and interpersonal skills that you feel help improve your own productivity and happiness, and the productivity and happiness of those around you.
 You have excellent spoken and written communication, time management, and project management abilities. You behave proactively to set expectations and find support when you recognize that there are unforeseen challenges or complexity in projects. 
You are comfortable asking questions and speaking up to help us continuously improve how we do things.


 What’s in it for you?
 We thrive on the challenge to be our best and work together to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. Here is what you can expect if you join our team:

 Work in an agile, collaborative and high-performing team
 The opportunity to do work that is challenging and take on progressively larger responsibilities
 Leaders who support your development through regular coaching
 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including competitive compensation, bonuses and flexible benefits


 About Ownr
 At Ownr, we have helped thousands of Canadians establish their businesses. As we redefine the entrepreneurship landscape, we take pride in simplifying what it takes to be a business owner. We're on a mission to become the leading platform for entrepreneurship in Canada, and it takes an entire team to build something big. So join our team and discover how we can help entrepreneurs make their dreams a reality.

 About RBCx
 RBCx pursues big, bold ideas and leverages RBC’s extensive experience, networks, and capital to help shape what’s next. Our four pillars – Banking, Capital, Platform, and Ventures – combine to support tech businesses of all sizes and stages, making us the go-to backer of Canadian innovation. Our people are our most valuable assets, which is why we invest deeply in making sure RBCx isn’t just a place to work, but a place to belong.

title: Software QA Engineer
description:
Why Verifone
 For more than 30 years Verifone has established a remarkable record of leadership in the electronic payment technology industry. Verifone has one of the leading electronic payment solutions brands and is one of the largest providers of electronic payment systems worldwide.
 Verifone has a diverse, dynamic and fast paced work environment in which employees are focused on results and have opportunities to excel. We take pride in the fact that we work with leading retailers, merchants, banks, and third party partners to invent and deliver innovative payments solution around the world. We strive for excellence in our products and services, and are obsessed with customer happiness. Across the globe, Verifone employees are leading the payments industry through experience, innovation, and an ambitious spirit. Whether it's developing the next platform of secure payment systems or searching for new ways to bring electronic payments to new markets, the team at Verifone is dedicated to the success of our customers, partners and investors. It is this passion for innovation that drives each one of our employees for personal and professionalsuccess.
 What's exciting about the role


Collaborate with engineers and acquirer representatives to understand product requirements to ensure successful remediation.
Triage and report failed test cases to development departments and facilitate investigation and delivery for any potential solutions.
Document the reported certification defects in JIRA, and work with development team to take appropriate corrective actions to improve/correct design.
Overview key design decisions, technology choice, structure and configuration of the solution ensuring it aligns with the certification requirements.
Report new or recurring problems to development departments and works to solutions.
Obtain, clarify, and impart technical knowledge regarding existing and newly released VeriFone products.
Identify and present solutions for process improvements.
Perform other related duties as assigned.


Skills and Experience we desire


Recognized Degree / Diploma in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a computer-related discipline.
Working knowledge of EMV transactions processing and EMV test tools.
Working experience in testing, product validation and payment application certifications in the card payments or banking industry,
Working experience with the banking/finance industry and/or payment applications.
Sense of urgency and drive to succeed. You should be comfortable working within a deadline driven environment, and flexible to work overtime when needed.
Proven track record working in a multitasking and dynamic environment.
Understanding of the complete end to end of software delivery and standard methodologies.
Experience working with hardware, software, QA, and product management teams.
Ability to learn and adapt to industry practices and company policies and procedures.
Self-motivated fast learner and great teammate who takes initiative and collaborates with others.

Personal Attributes:

High energy level, can-do mentality, resilient, and good work ethic.
We value integrity, honesty, maturity.
You have a strong partner and customer focus.
Committed to striving for continuous improvement every single day, while also having fun. You identify as a dedicated, creative self-starter who isn't afraid to take initiative.

Our commitment
 Verifone is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Verifone is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.
